meanings.definition: The state or quality of being superior.
meanings.sent1: Her superiorities in academics earned her the top spot in the class.
meanings.sent2: The team's superiorities in skills helped them win the championship.
meanings.sent3: His superiorities in video games made him the undisputed champion among his friends.
meanings.sent4: The company's superiorities in customer service set them apart from their competitors.
meanings.sent5: The superhero's superiorities in strength and speed made him unbeatable in battle.

meanings.sent1: Having a supportive family is one of life's greatest superiorities.
meanings.sent2: The new technology offers many superiorities over the old system.
meanings.sent3: His quick wit proved to be a superiority during the debate.
meanings.sent4: The team's speed on the field was their superiority over the opponents.
meanings.sent5: The chef's secret recipe gave her a culinary superiority that others envied.

meanings.definition: The quality or condition of being higher in rank or status.
meanings.sent1: In the military, promotions are based on one's superiorities.
meanings.sent2: Her superiorities in the company led to her being promoted to manager.
meanings.sent3: The cat's superiority in the household was evident by how it commanded attention.
meanings.sent4: The king's superiority was unquestioned by all in the kingdom.
meanings.sent5: The artist's superiority in the art world was recognized by critics and fans alike.
